465c6291-8f7d-4350-b14a-c49097f2fe4c.description: Individual has demonstrated competency in: 1) Reading, comprehending, and analyzing college-level materials; 2) recognizing the need for information and locating, evaluating, and effectively synthesizing needed information; and 3) utilizing computer software and other technologies to enhance college-level learning, communication, and visual literacy.
465c6291-8f7d-4350-b14a-c49097f2fe4c.name: Workplace Documents

issuer.summary: issued by Prince George's Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Awarded after successful completion of INT-1010, Introduction to Information Technology and one General Education Humanities or Social Science course with a grade of "B" or higher. Students awarded this badge have documented proficiency in reading and using work-related text and applying information from workplace documents to solve problems.

62dd6205-178f-49b2-bae3-21770aad43b0.description: Individual has demonstrated competency in: 1) Recognizing the need for information and locating, evaluating, and effectively synthesizing needed information; and 2) explaining natural processes and analyzing issues using appropriate evidence, employing the principles of the biological, physical, and/or behavioral sciences.
62dd6205-178f-49b2-bae3-21770aad43b0.name: Graphic Literacy

issuer.summary: issued by Prince George's Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Awarded after successful completion of one General Education Science course and one General Education Humanities or Social Sciences course with a grade of "B" or higher. Students awarded this badge have documented proficiency in locating, synthesizing, and applying information that is presented graphically and comparing, summarizing, and analyzing information presented in multiple related graphics.

7d8cbcbb-94aa-4502-8610-efa96b7a16e7.description: Individual has demonstrated competency in: 1) Comprehending mathematical concepts and methods; and 2) engaging in qualitative and quantitative reasoning to interpret, analyze, and solve problems.
7d8cbcbb-94aa-4502-8610-efa96b7a16e7.name: Applied Math

issuer.summary: issued by Prince George's Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Awarded after successful completion of one General Education Mathematics course and one General Education Science course with a grade of "B" or higher. Students awarded this badge have documented proficiency in applying mathematical reasoning to work-related problems and setting up and performing work-related mathematical calculations.

46702b8a-dab4-4062-a763-c7ddafdd2370.description: Upon successful completion of this course, participants will be able to enter new, revision, and deletion proposals for both courses and programs in Curriculog and review and revise proposals moving through the approval process.
46702b8a-dab4-4062-a763-c7ddafdd2370.name: Curriculum Proposal Basics

issuer.summary: issued by Prince George's Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Participants 1) complete a 2-hour training and 4-hour practicum; 2) select appropriate approval process, import/manipulate data, enter information into correct field and attach documents; 3) validate and launch proposal; 4) make revisions to rejected proposals; and 5) follow proposal through approval process to completion.

29d135de-81d9-46b9-b2fd-347b71392d25.description: This badge is issued to students who successfully demonstrate knife safety, identify how knife cuts connect to recipes, practice proper sanitation, and demonstrate proper knife cuts. After completing this course, students will be able to perform proper knife cuts using proper techniques. To successfully complete the course, students must achieve 75% or higher on the skills assessment.
29d135de-81d9-46b9-b2fd-347b71392d25.name: Knife Skills

issuer.summary: issued by Prince George's Community College

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Demonstrate safe and sanitary kitchen practices.  2. Identify knife cut names and dimensions.  3. Demonstrate proper knife cutting techniques.  4. Demonstrate how to sharpen and hone knives.

d7be41ad-4a77-48e8-a877-3eb1ad7d0f3b.description: This badge is issued to students who successfully demonstrate proper kitchen measuring techniques. In this course students will be using scales, dry measuring and liquid measuring tools to measure various ingredients. Students will be able to identify proper measuring tools for specific recipe task. Students must score a 75% or better.
d7be41ad-4a77-48e8-a877-3eb1ad7d0f3b.name: Measuring Skills

issuer.summary: issued by Prince George's Community College

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Demonstrate how to use multiple measuring techniques.  2. Demonstrate how to use liquid and dry measuring tools.  3. Identify tools used for measuring.  4. Utilize various scales for weighing ingredients.

7af470b4-4fe5-4e69-a763-a3ca71ddf00a.description: The Cultural Competency in Healthcare badge focuses on skills and knowledge that values diversity, cultural differences, increases awareness of providers’ and healthcare organizations’ cultural norms as well as implicit bias. The badge is issued to students who successfully demonstrate health equity to diverse populations, increased awareness of one’s implicit bias, demonstrate proficiency in cultural humility, national CLAS standards and create cultural appropriate content.
7af470b4-4fe5-4e69-a763-a3ca71ddf00a.name: Cultural Competency in Healthcare

issuer.summary: issued by Prince George's Community College

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Analyze the importance of a multicultural perspective overview of health. 2. Demonstrate proficiency in cultural humility 3. Adhere to National CLAS standards 4. Recognize one’s implicit bias 5. Create culturally appropriate public facing material/content

97a12a61-677b-4a0a-882b-138cb7bef026.description: Safe and Secure ! Dining in the New Normal addresses specific preventative practices to decrease the spread of coronavirus while dining. Processes involved in food safety, cleaning, sanitizing, and disinfecting are addressed. Basic mode of transmission and symptoms of COVID-19 and common foodborne pathogens presented. Tools that decrease health risks from employees and customers are outlined. Methods to facilitate food safety during food deliveries, take-out and curbside pick-up are identified.
97a12a61-677b-4a0a-882b-138cb7bef026.name: Safe and Secure ! Dining in the New Normal

issuer.summary: issued by Prince George's Community College

badge_template_activities.title: 1.Describe the 4 basic food safety steps .  2.Describe the 5 steps involved in the cleaning process.  3.Describe the 6 steps involved in the sanitizing /disinfecting process.  4. List 6 factors involved in personal hygiene.  5. List tools that protect employees from contracting contagious conditions/diseases .  6. Discuss 3 methods that encourage social distancing in the food establishment.  7. List methods that facilitate food safety during food delivery or food pick-up.
